When Babangida ap- pointed Alex Akinyele to head the nation's sports for his clowning and over-adulation of his regime, the Minna-born General re-named it National Srorts Commission and placed it under the Presidency.

The truth is that Nigeria de- serves a Sports Ministry, considering the good image sports has brought to the nation, espe- cially in the past four years. All over the world, minister of sports sit at cabinet meetings with their colleagues in other ministries. In Nigeria, with sports under the presi- dency, the 'Executive Chairman' is attended to by junior officers. Why? I am sure it is only in Nigeria that five different persons would be at the helm of affairs of such a continuity-embracing industry as sports in four short years, 1990 - Ikhazoboh, 1991 - Yohannah Kure, 1992 - Alex Akinyele, 1993 - Sylvanus Akinwunmi, 1994 - Babashola Rhodes. I am sure it is only in Nigeria that five different persons would be at the helm of affairs of such a continuity-embracing industry as sports in four short years, 1990 - Ikhazoboh, 1991 - Yohannah Kure, 1992 - Alex Akinyele, 1993 - Sylvanus Akinwunmi, 1994 - Babashola Rhodes.

The pity of it all is that these changes have always been in- formed by considerations other than for the much-talked about national interest. These persons, most of them with little or no background training or any form of grind in sports, found them- selves with the spoon but knowing not what to do with the soup. Babashola Rhodes has for sometime come to be known as an influential figure in Nigerian sports not for any past record of being an international athlete or a sponsor of note, but for his ser- vices to the northern military adventurers which borders on the bizzare. Rhodes a lawyer, began a lawn tennis championship named after his legal outfits Rhodes and Rhodes in 1992. There was much noise about the competition then, and he promised to make it an annual event. PMSports gathered at the National Sports Commission [NSC] Headquar- ters in Lagos, that the shake up would only affect associations that have remained inactive this year. An NSC source disclosed/that the new sole administrator, Chief Shola Rhodes is not out to witch-hunt any- body or association but to breadth some life into sports and bring the nation back to its lost glory in sports.
